titleStmt.title: A Letter from the nobility, barons, and commons of Scotland in the year 1320, yet extant under all the seals of nobility, directed to Pope John wherein they declare their firm resolutions to adhere to their king, Robert the Bruce, as the restorer of the safety, and liberties of the people, and as having the true right of succession, but withall, they notwithstanding declare, that if the king should offer to subvert their civil liberties, they will disown him as an enemy, and choose another to be king, for their own defense / translated from the original, in Latine ... by Sir George M'Kenzie.
titleStmt.author: John XXII, Pope, d. 1334.
Mackenzie, George, Sir, 1636-1691.

notesStmt.note: English and Latin in parallel columns.
